perturbation.original_text: Section 7.01  [Disclaimer of General Warranty by PrimeCall]. Disclaimer of General Warranty by PrimeCall. PRIMECALL MAKES NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, CONCERNING THE SERVICES PROVIDED HEREUNDER, INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, MERCHANTABILITY OR OTHERWISE. IN NO EVENT SHALL PRIMECALL BE LIABLE TO DELTATHREE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUES OR DATA WHETHER BASED ON BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, WHETHER OR NOT DELTATHREE HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THE LIABILITY OF PRIMECALL FOR DAMAGES OR ALLEGED DAMAGES HEREUNDER, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR ANY OTHER LEGAL THEORY, IS LIMITED TO, AND WILL NOT EXCEED, DELTATHREE'S DIRECT DAMAGES.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 2.04 [PrimeCall Warranty]. PrimeCall's warranty, if any, will be limited to direct damages only, and does not cover any special, incidental, or consequential damages. The specifics of any warranty will be determined at PrimeCall's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original disclaimer of warranty in Section 7.01 is moved to Section 2 and reworded to suggest a warranty might exist, but with vague and limited terms at PrimeCall's discretion. This is a contradiction since previously the text stated that there were no representations of warranty express or implied.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) Article 2 on Sales - Implied Warranty of Merchantability and Fitness for a Particular Purpose

perturbation.original_text: Section 7.02  [Disclaimer of General Warranty by DeltaThree]. DELTATHREE MAKES NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, CONCERNING THE SERVICES PROVIDED HEREUNDER, INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, MERCHANTABILITY OR OTHERWISE. IN NO EVENT SHALL DELTATHREE BE LIABLE TO PRIMECALL FOR ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUES OR DATA WHETHER BASED ON BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, WHETHER OR NOT PRIMECALL HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THE LIABILITY OF DELTATHREE FOR DAMAGES OR ALLEGED DAMAGES HEREUNDER, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR ANY OTHER LEGAL THEORY, IS LIMITED TO, AND WILL NOT EXCEED, PRIMECALL'S DIRECT DAMAGES.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 4.04 [DeltaThree Warranty]. DeltaThree's warranty liability will be limited to direct damages unless otherwise required by law. Any extended warranty will be a subject to review by DeltaThree Legal.
perturbation.explanation: The original disclaimer of warranty in Section 7.02 is moved to Section 4 and reworded to suggest a warranty might exist, but with vague and limited terms at DeltaThree's discretion. This creates a legal contradiction because the implied warranty disclaimers were moved, and because it is not clear if the warranties are real or implied.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) Article 2 on Sales - Implied Warranty of Merchantability and Fitness for a Particular Purpose

perturbation.original_text:
Section 9.11  [Governing Law]. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York, without giving effect to the conflict of laws principles thereof. For purposes of this

Source: DELTATHREE INC, S-1/A, 11/2/1999

Agreement, each party hereby irrevocably submits to the nonexclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the State of New York, sitting in New York County, and the courts of the United States for the Southern District of New York. Each party irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any objection which it may now or hereafter have to the laying of the venue of any such suit, action or proceeding brought in any such court, any claim that any such suit, action or proceeding brought in such a court has been brought in an inconvenient forum and the right to object, with respect to any such suit, action or proceeding brought in any such court, that such court does not have jurisdiction over such party. In any such suit, action or proceeding, each party waives, to the fullest extent it may effectively do so, personal service of any summons, complaint or other process and agrees that the service thereof may be made by certified or registered mail, addressed to such party at its address set forth in Section 9.03  [Notices]. Each party agrees that a final non-appealable judgment in any such suit, action or proceeding brought in such a court shall be conclusive and binding.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 9.11 [Governing Law]. This agreement is subject to the laws of New York, unless those laws conflict with the general principles of fairness and equity, in which case, the governing law will be decided by mutual agreement. Jurisdiction will be in New York, unless it proves unduly burdensome.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces a contradiction. It states the agreement is subject to New York law, but then introduces a condition where that law might be superseded by 'general principles of fairness and equity,' and a method to determine the governing law after that. This undermines the certainty and enforceability of the original governing law clause. The reference to 'unduly burdensome' further undermines the jurisdiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Governing Law and Jurisdiction
